commitResults.messageTitle: [#747] SystemTest: Delete ft_temp folder after test (#973)
commitResults.messageBody:
ft_temp folder is generated after running system test.

This folder is unnecessary to stay in our repo directory and may 
confuse code navigation.

Let's add a cleanup method to delete the folder after the system 
test.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#940] ReportGenerator#generateReposReport: SLAP copying of template file (#977)
commitResults.messageBody:
The operation to copy template file before cloning and analyzing the
repositories in ReportGenerator#generateReposReport is specified at 
a granular level.

It clashes with the higher level of abstraction used for the other
operations in ReportGenerator#generateReposReport.

Let's abstract out the copying of template files into a separate 
method and then call this method from 
ReportGenerator#generateReposReport.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1044] Update date hashes on reset date range (#1068)
commitResults.messageBody:
Resetting the date range would occasionally not change the date 
hashes in the URL, causing a refresh of the page to load the 
outdated filter date range. 

This bug occurs when until or since date is not specified on
generating the report.

Let's make sure that the date hashes gets updated all the time.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#850] Ignore git submodules when analyzing repos (#1127)
commitResults.messageBody:
Repos that contains git submodules are not handled properly and cannot
be analyzed.

This is due to the diff result including the submodule information.

Let set `--ignore-submodules=all` in the git diff command to ignore all
submodule information.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1178] Make github profile and repo hyperlinks more consistent (#1186)
commitResults.messageBody:
When grouped by repo, the same icon to link to the repo is duplicated
multiple times for no reason. Also, the icon to link to the author's
profile is hard to find.

We can make the links more intuitive and consistent by putting links to
the author's profile beside author names, and links to repo beside repo
names.

Let's reorder the icon group such that the hyperlinks are closer to the
respective names, as well as always showing the icons beside their
respective names. As this change heavily relies on the icons being
responsive, let's resolve issue #1191 as well to make use of
vue-fontawesome to make the icons responsive.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1249] Disable view code icon when merge group and group by authors (#1250)
commitResults.messageBody:
View code icon shows when group by authors and merge group is
selected.

However, the functionality is not implemented yet. Clicking on the
icon shows garbage results.

Let's remove the icon when group by authors and merge group is selected.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1146] Add caret icon to indicate collapsible authorship file panel (#1169)
commitResults.messageBody:
It is not apparent that the authorship file details can be collapsed by
clicking on the title.

Let's add caret icons to show that the title is clickable to collapse the
file details view.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change totalLineCount and totalBlankLineCount to computed values (#1088)
commitResults.messageBody:
The variables `totalLineCount` and `totalBlankLineCount` are 
calculated in `processFiles()`, a method that executes a big chunk
of logic.

Their values are calculated in a loop through every files, which is
inefficient when we can instead calculate it from
`getFileTypeExistingLinesObj` and `fileTypeBlankLinesObj` which already
have most of the the information available.

Let's extract out the calculations into computed values from
`getFileTypeExistingLinesObj` and `fileTypeBlankLinesObj` which is
clearer and more efficient.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1083] RepoConfiguration: remove `annotationOverwrite` flag  (#1117)
commitResults.messageBody:
There is an `annotationOverwrite` flag in the `RepoConfiguration`. 
The flag is redundant because it defaults to `true` and is never 
utilized in the main code.

Since there is currently no planned use case, for better code 
quality, we should remove the unnecessary code.

Let's remove this flag from the `RepoConfiguration`.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1058] PublishingGuide: Provide a way to use GitHub actions to auto-generate the dashboard (#1078)
commitResults.messageBody:
The only way to leverage on CI and auto-generate the dashboard
is by using Travis CI, a third-party service.

We can provide a way to use GitHub Actions to auto-generate the 
dashboard so that users have an alternative option now and do not 
have to rely on third-party services for deployment.

Let's add the documentation which shows users how to auto-generate 
the dashboard using GitHub Actions.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1230] v_zoom: hide `show all commit messages` when no message is available (#1231)
commitResults.messageBody:
The `show all commit messages`  button on the zoom view displays 
even when there is no message available to show. 

This may cause confusion to the user because clicking on the button 
gives no effect.

Let's hide the link when there is no available message to show.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1221] Allow merging of individual groups (#1223)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently the `merge group` checkbox only supports merging/expanding all 
groups. 

It is inconvenient for users who want to have an overview across all 
repos first, then take a detailed look within a particular group, because
there is a need to relocate the group on the page after expanding all 
groups. This is especially the case when there are many authors and repos
on the dashboard.

Let's add the feature to allow merging/expanding individual groups 
instead.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1271] Fix missing filter by filetype radio button (#1273)
commitResults.messageBody:
The filter by file type radio button is missing in authorship tab 
due to inappropriate css properties.

Let's fix the css properties to make it visible.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1279] Provide a way to run analysis for a moving window (#1280)
commitResults.messageBody:
Some users might want to monitor repositories for a moving window rather
than from a specific date.

We can give a CLI option that runs the analysis for a period of specific 
length e.g., `--period 7d` runs the analysis for the last 7 days, and
`--period 1w` runs the analysis for the last 1 week.

Period can combine with either since date or until date, but not both.
If both not supplied, it will be the period before the current date.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1021]: Use BASE_URL constant instead of string  (#1033)
commitResults.messageBody:
There are multiple occurrences of the same string 
'https://github.com' in the frontend.

Let's replace the string with a constant 'BASE_URL' in the files.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1046] v_summary: refactor duplicate code (#1056)
commitResults.messageBody:
There is an instance of code duplication in 'v_summary.js'. 
Specifically, the definition of a function that is passed to the 
comparator has been duplicated in the case of grouping by repos and 
by authors.

Let's extract this duplicated portion of code into a helper function 
so that it may be referenced by the comparator.

There are instances of unused code across the files
`RepoLocation.java`, `LogsManager.java` and `FileUtil.java`.

Let's remove them for better code quality.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#937] Use generic 'throw Exception' in all tests (#1072)
commitResults.messageBody:
It is alright to use a generic "throws Exception" in test cases,
as all exceptions result in failure.

Let's use a generic "throws Exception" clause in all tests.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1052] Add issue templates (#1063)
commitResults.messageBody:
Issue templates help guide the user to provide the required information
needed for a developer to understand what is required. Templates for 
bug reports, feature requests and documentation changes help clarify 
the motivation as well as summarize the expectations and requirements.

Let's add issue templates for these issue types.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#806, #951] ReportGenerator: return paths of generated files (#939)
commitResults.messageBody:
The method `ReportGenerator#generateReposReport` returns a list of
paths to the JSON files that need to be zipped. 

However, the list is made up by the file paths of expected output and
not the file paths of actual generated files. As a good practice, and
also to ensure that only the correct files are zipped, the latter is
preferred. 

Let's return a Optional<Path> from `FileUtil#writeJsonFile` so that
callers of this method can determine whether a JSON file was
successfully generated.

This allows `generateReposReport` to only return paths to JSON files
that were successfully generated.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#871, #952] CSV files: ignore blank lines before the header (#903)
commitResults.messageBody:
CsvParser treats the first non-empty line as the header row.

When a CSV file contains blank line(s) above the header, the blank line
would be taken as the header, causing the subsequent rows in the CSV
file to be flagged as malformed. Hence, any CSV file with blank lines
before the header will be parsed incorrectly. 

Let's modify CsvParser such that it skips all the blank lines preceding
the header, and picks the first non blank line as the header.

The Apache Commons CSV library currently does not provide any methods
to skip blank lines preceding the header. This limitation is documented
in:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CSV-127 

Hence, let's implement a custom line-skipping behavior using a
BufferedReader.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#934] CsvParser: Remove extra comma in warning logs (#935)
commitResults.messageBody:
When a line in a CSV config is found to be malformed, the logger prints 
the contents of the line in a warning message. The current method causes
an extra comma to be printed.

This extra comma may make debugging more confusing.

Let's modify the method used to extract the contents of a line, such 
that there are no extra commas.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#736] CLI: allow "--ignore-standalone-config" flag to override CSV values (#928)
commitResults.messageBody:
RepoSense ignores the --ignore-standalone-config command line flag when
parsing a repo-config csv file.

We can allow the --ignore-standalone-config command line flag to
override all entries in the "Ignore Standalone Config" column of
repo-config.csv. This provides users with an easy method of setting
this flag for all repos, without having to edit each line of the csv.

To achieve this, let's move the isStandaloneConfigIgnored attribute
from the LocationsCliArguments class, to its superclass: CliArguments.
This will allow us to access the --ignore-standalone-config flag's
value when parsing RepoConfigurations from both LocationsCliArguments
and ConfigCliArguments.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#872] CsvParser: improve exception handling when a csv file has incorrect number of columns in header (#955)
commitResults.messageBody:
RepoSense crashes abruptly when any of the CSV config files do not 
have the expected number of columns in their headers.

We should catch this error early and provide the user with a clearer
error message.

Let's add a header validation step to the CSV parsing process. This 
step will verify if the CSV file's header has the right number of 
columns.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1001] CSS: Increase z-index for center divider div (#1011)
commitResults.messageBody:
When we scroll horizontally in the Code Panel, the code snippets and 
code toggle buttons overlap with the center divider.

Let's fix this bug by increasing the z-index of the #tab-resize div, and 
the div that closes the right tab. We can use a value of 100, since the 
z-index of #tab-resize-guide div is already set to 100. For better 
scalability, let's also use a SASS map to store these z-index values.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1032] Author: fix error in copy constructor (#1036)
commitResults.messageBody:
The Author class has a constructor that accepts an existing Author
object and creates a copy. 

However, the constructor assigns the list of author aliases of the 
copied instance to the `ignoreGlobList` attribute of the new 
instance.

Let's fix this error so methods that use this constructor will not
face erroneous behavior.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#942] CsvParser: Improve exception handling when csv config has no valid recods (#916)
commitResults.messageBody:
RepoSense crashes with an unhelpful error message if the repo-config
csv has zero valid records.

If the repo-config csv has no valid records, we should provide a
clear warning to the user and then terminate execution. In the case 
of optional csv files, we should provide a warning and then continue 
execution.

Let's 
- implement this behaviour by explicity checking the number of valid
  records found by CsvParser. 
- throw an InvalidCsvException if there are no valid records in a 
  csv file.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1022] FileInfoAnalyzer: Deprecate "//@reused" tag (#1039)
commitResults.messageBody:
RepoSense will not include a file in the authorship analysis if the 
first line of the file contains the `//@reused` string.

This feature is not being used.

Let's remove this feature to simplify the codebase.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1076] Author: add a `isIgnoringFile` method (#1085)
commitResults.messageBody:
There are a few instances where we obtain the `ignoreGlobMatcher` 
from an Author instance first to manually check if this matches with 
a given file path.

Let's allow the Author instance to tell clients if it is ignoring a 
particular file (given a filepath) - instead of giving clients the
ignoreGlobMatcher and letting clients figure out the answer on their 
own.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1060] Report: record time taken for report generation in hidden element (#1066)
commitResults.messageBody:
It is sometimes not possible / inconvenient to retrieve the 
RepoSense log output, if we want to view the time taken for 
generating a report.

Let's record the time taken for report generation, as a hidden
element in the report as well as a field in the summary.json file.
This will allow developers to find out the amount of time taken
in generating the report.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#823, #981] AnnotatorAnalyzer: Fix code disowning mechanism (#1067)
commitResults.messageBody:
Suppose that `random-user` is not the git author name of any author
in a git repository(i.e. it is just a placeholder name). RepoSense 
does not correctly mark code as disowned when a user marks a code 
block with the `@@author random-user` tag. Only the line containing 
the `@@author random-user` tag is treated as disowned, while the 
remaining code block is still attributed to the author deduced from 
the git blame analysis.

This bug occurs because the code in AnnotatorAnalyzer uses a 
constant UNKNOWN_AUTHOR to represent both the case where there is no 
currently active annotation override AND the case where the user has 
used a "@@author random-user" tag.

Let's use Optionals to store the author names obtained from the
`@@author` tags, so we can identify the case where the user has used
a `@@author random-user` tag.

commitResults.messageTitle: Docs: Update current members' list (#1208)
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's update the list of current members to include
the new contributors.

commitResults.messageTitle: Call validateFilePaths in unix_cloneInvalidWindowsFilePaths_success (#1210)
commitResults.messageBody:
When RepoSense is run on Windows OS, it uses the 'validateFilePaths' 
method of the GitLsTree class to verify  if all the file paths in 
the repo are valid file paths on Windows OS.

Within unix_cloneInvalidWindowsFilePaths_success test case, it 
checks whether 'validateFilePaths' method runs correctly on 
non Windows OS. However, this test does not actually call
the `validateFilePaths` method.

Let's call 'validateFilePaths' in the test case, so we can 
confirm that the method works correctly on non Windows OS.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#997] README / Home Page: Describe RepoSense features from users' perspective (#1018)
commitResults.messageBody:
While the README / Home Page have a list of RepoSense's capabilities,
this might not sufficiently convey the value of using RepoSense.

Let's frame RepoSense's features from the users' perspective. 
This will help readers appreciate the product. At the same time, 
let's also make some minor grammar fixes.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1263] Tests: Simplify resource loading (#1264)
commitResults.messageBody:
Tests: Simplify code used for loading resources

In many of our tests, we make repeated use of the ClassLoader 
to obtain the path to each resource used in the tests. 
This has resulted in a lot of repetitive code.

Let's create a helper method to reduce this repetition,
and simplify the resource loading code.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1257] AuthorConfigCsvParser: Initialize author fully before adding to config (#1270)
commitResults.messageBody:
The `AuthorConfigCsvParser` adds each `Author` object to the
`AuthorConfiguration` before the author is fully initialized
with its details (emails, aliases, display name, ignore glob list).

This requires the `AuthorConfiguration` to be updated again after 
the `Author` object is fully initialized. 

Let's initialize the `Author` object fully before adding it into the
`AuthorConfiguration` object. With this change, we can also remove
the code that re-updates the author config after initializing the 
`Author` object.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#931] Code view: Default sorting in descending order (#932)
commitResults.messageBody:
In Code view, the default order for LoC is ascending.

Let's make the default order descending as it is more meaningful to
have bigger changes on top as they should be more interesting.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#352] User Guide: add quick start guide to use RepoSense with Netlify (#924)
commitResults.messageBody:
Users would need to download .jar file to run RepoSense.

Let's add a quick start section to User Guide to instruct users to 
use RepoSense through Netlify so they can get started without 
downloading any files. This should ease users into using RepoSense.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#947] Synchronising different tab views (#948)
commitResults.messageBody:
It's difficult to distinguish between the authorship and zoom views as 
there are no obvious symbols to identify which is which. 

Let's add a header to both the views for easy identification and a link 
to the zoom title to make it more consistent with authorship.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#960]Refactor Authorship Css (#986)
commitResults.messageBody:
The JS/HTML code of each component has already rested in its own 
file, but all the CSS are still in one file. 

Let's refactor the Authorship CSS into a new file for better 
scalability and readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#960] Refactor Summary CSS (#1003)
commitResults.messageBody:
The JS/HTML code of each component has already rested in its own 
file, but all the CSS are still in one file. 

Let's refactor the Summary CSS into a new file for better scalability 
and readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#964] Add UG link to report page (#983)
commitResults.messageBody:
The link to the UG in the documents points to the released version of 
the UG. As a result, there may be some discrepancies between the master 
and the release branch.

Let's add a link to the UG on the report page corresponding to the 
version that RepoSense was ran on.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#873, #1016, #1049]Enable octocat icon for merge group (#1017)
commitResults.messageBody:
There are not a lot of features that the user can use when merge 
group is active. 

Let's 
  - add the octocat icon to enhance the usage of merge group. 
  - fix the thickness of contribution bars by changing rem to pix.

When it's `group by Repo`, the octocat icon will link to the group's
repository. When it's `group by Author`, the octocat icon will link 
to the author's github profile.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#960] Refactor Ramp CSS (#1055)
commitResults.messageBody:
The JS/HTML code of each component has already rested in its own 
file, but all the CSS are still in one file. 

Let's refactor the Ramp CSS into a new file for better scalability 
and readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#522] Implement style checker on .pug files (#987)
commitResults.messageBody:
RepoSense has CheckStyle, ESLint and Stylelint to check our java, 
javascript and css code styles automatically. However, `.pug` files 
are not covered by any of these tools.

Let's implement pug-lint to check the code styles of .pug files.

TODO: Add a line wrap rule in the future

commitResults.messageTitle: [#906, #994, #1006] UserGuide: update doc and remove errors (#907)
commitResults.messageBody:
With the recently added group-config.csv file, the new changes 
possible in the local configuration are not reflected in the
documentation.

Users can configure their csv files to analyse multiple repos in 
their own custom way, but they may be confused about how to do so as 
the user guide is outdated. 

Let's update the user guide to reflect the changes possible through
group-config.csv in the local configuration to analyse multiple 
repos. Let's also fix the errors in the Tool Bar section and fix the 
formatting of repo-config.csv example.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#947] Authorship view: update sort controls (#1074)
commitResults.messageBody:
The sort controls in the Authorship view are a value updated by
watched property. 

This is not as efficient as a computed property. 

Let's make the sort controls in Authorship view a computed property. 
This will also help in making the code across different views 
consistent.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#960] Refactor Zoom CSS (#1079)
commitResults.messageBody:
The JS/HTML code of each component has already rested in its own 
file, but all the CSS are still in one file. 

Let's refactor the Zoom CSS into a new file for better scalability 
and readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1061] build.gradle: remove unused dependency (#1095)
commitResults.messageBody:
There is an unused dependency in the Gradle config.

Let's remove the unused dependencies to reduce the build time.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1004] Make Code Panel consistent with Chart Panel (#1080)
commitResults.messageBody:
The Code Panel and Chart Panel look very different from each other.

Making them be more similar can enhance the user experience.

Let's
- make file title similar to Github's way of displaying
- change background for Code and Commit Panel to white
- change sidebar color to grey

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1144, #1135] Docs: update outdated info (#1149)
commitResults.messageBody:
There is a lot of outdated info in the User Guide and Developer 
Guide.

Let's 
- update the UG and DG to show the current state of RepoSense as 
  this will help people better in using/developing RepoSense.
- remove the warnings reported by Travis by removing the trailing
  whitespaces.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#960] panels.scss: refactor common panel style (#1104)
commitResults.messageBody:
The JS/HTML code of each component has already rested in its 
own file, but all the CSS are in one file. 

Let's refactor the common components shared across panels to 
a common file for scalability and readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1188] Improve implementation of ignoring authors  (#1189)
commitResults.messageBody:
The ignored authors are removed from the list by calling 
resetAuthorInformation, which clears the authorDisplayNameMap 
and authorEmailsAndAliasesMap and sets the authorList all again.

Let's improve this implementation by just removing the authors to
be ignored.

commitResults.messageTitle: Deploy MarkBind site (#1222)
commitResults.messageBody:
Our documentation has migrated to MarkBind, but users have no link 
available to view the latest MarkBind documentation site from our 
master branch.

Let's deploy the MarkBind site to gh pages, subsequently we can provide
the gh pages link in our README to provide the link to the users.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1198] Replace custom font class names with @mixin (#1211)
commitResults.messageBody:
We are using class names such as `mini-font`, `medium-font` etc to 
inject font size css to those components. This results in nesting a 
lot of unnecessary class names for those components that want to 
inherit such font sizes.

We can utilise css mixins and include instead, which eliminates the
need to nest/append class names, resulting to a more cleaner html 
structure.

Let's create css mixins for font sizes to allow a more cleaner html
structure.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1139] Remove no-param-reassign warnings (#1267)
commitResults.messageBody:
When running `npm lint` under frontend a large number of
`no-param-reassign` warnings are displayed.

Let's prevent the warnings from being displayed.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Gradle Version (#1300)
commitResults.messageBody:
The `downloadNode` Gradle extension is outdated, as a result, CI is 
failing. 

Let's update the Gradle version to keep up to date with its 
development.

From Gradle 5.0 onwards, the tasks running with code coverage are 
configured to delete the execution data before they start executing
another task. As a result, our code coverage dropped significantly 
since we use the same file to store the execution data of the 
different tests. 

Let's also use different files to store the execution data of the 
different tests to fix this problem.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix naming of cypress test file (#1307)
Github Action for Closing Stale PRs (#1299)
commitResults.messageBody:
Few PRs are left open for a long time without any follow-up activity 
from the author of the PRs. 

This prevents other developers from taking up the issue and solving 
it. Therefore, the senior developers need to find such PRs manually 
and close them.

Let's automate the process of closing inactive PRs using GitHub 
Actions.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1232] Fix footer link (#1305)
commitResults.messageBody:
The link in the footer of the RepoSense report is outdated as we have moved
everything to the website.

Let's update the links in the footer to point to the website based on whether 
a specific version or master is being used for deployment. 

If the master branch is used for deployment, we point to the latest UG. If the 
latest release is used, we point to the UG in the production site.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1333] Fix loading of local reports (#1335)
commitResults.messageBody:
The loading page can load infinitely because it may try to call 
`startsWith` with `version` that is undefined.

Let's fix it by adding a check to see if `version` is undefined or 
not.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1220] Add more frontend tests (#1310)
commitResults.messageBody:
Our frontend testing coverage is rather low, hence UI regressions 
can happen very often.

Let's add more frontend tests to prevent UI regressions.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1301] Update outdated links of showcase (#1338)
commitResults.messageBody:
The links to reports in the showcase for the first two examples are 
outdated and don't show the latest features of RepoSense.

Let's update them to show the latest features of RepoSense.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#436] Give warning for duplicate alias (#1187)
commitResults.messageBody:
Duplicate aliases in the csv files or standalone config do not trigger 
any warning. As a result,the user might not get to know that there are 
duplicate aliases in the csv files provided by him/her.

Let's give a warning if there are duplicate aliases in the csv file or 
standalone config to notify the user that the alias will belong to the 
last person who claims it.

commitResults.messageTitle: Github Action: close stale PRs (#1399)
commitResults.messageBody:
Few PRs are left open for a long time without any follow-up activity 
from the author of the PRs. 

This prevents other developers from taking up the issue and solving 
it. Therefore, the senior developers need to find such PRs manually 
and close them.

Let's automate the process of closing inactive PRs using GitHub 
Actions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Documentation: fix grammatical mistakes (#1389)
commitResults.messageBody:
There are a few grammatical mistakes on the different web pages of 
the RepoSense website.

Let's fix the remaining grammatical errors.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#46] Show total time after batch processing (#758)
commitResults.messageBody:
After running the CLI command, the total time taken to process and 
generate the report is not shown in the console output.

Users might find it useful to keep track of the time taken to 
generate the report.

Let's use the logger to output the total time taken from running the 
CLI command until the report is generated.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#785] ChartView: fix authors with unaccounted lines (#789)
commitResults.messageBody:
The git blame command used in RepoSense contains the option -w, which
ignores whitespace when comparing the parent’s version and the child’s
to find where the lines came from.

When an author did not change the content but only the position of
specific lines of code, the previous author will be recognised as the 
author that changed these lines. If the previous author did not
contribute during the analysis period, his/her ramp chart will be
empty while the contribution bar will be present.

Let's add an extra check in aggregateBlameInfo for lines of code with
the author committed date that is not within the duration of 
specified since date and until date. Those lines of code's author will
be set to unknown, which will resolve the issue above.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#879] Display commit tags in commits panel (#969)
commitResults.messageBody:
The tags of each commit are not shown in the commits panel.

With the active use of git tags in CS21x3 repositories, it is useful to 
provide tutors on the usage and information of tags in each commit.

Let's display the tags of each commit (if there's any) in the commits 
panel.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#984] Fix miscalculation of expanded commit message count (#998)
commitResults.messageBody:
We get the number of expanded commit message count in zoom tab based on
the number of divs with class name 'commit-message active'.

Commit messages without commit message bodies also have default class
name of 'commit-message active', which leads to the expanded commit
message count to not reflect on the true number of commit messages that
are expanded.

Let's append the class name 'message-body' to commit messages that have
commit message bodies, to distinguish between messages that can be
expanded and vice versa.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1029] Contribution Bar: restore the float left property (#1030)
commitResults.messageBody:
Due to the regression of #1003, the css property 'float: left' was left
out in the contribution bar. When break down by file type is checked,
the contribution bar for each file type occupies separate lines
instead of continuous lines.

Let's restore the css property 'float: left' back to the contribution
bar.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1019] Handle commit info extraction for empty commits (#1020)
commitResults.messageBody:
Analyzing repo with empty commits causes CommitInfoAnalyzer to throw 
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException. This occurs in 
CommitInfoExtractor#parseGitLogResults, where info lines and stat 
lines are split based on the last index of the newline character 
`\n`.

As empty commits have no stat lines, it leads to 
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException due to the use of new line separator.

Let's:
- use '|' character as the splitting point of info lines and stat 
  lines, instead of the new line '\n' character. This will ensure 
  that the ref name details will always be within info lines instead
  of stat lines.
- add a check for the availability of the ref name before accessing 
  it to prevent the exception. 

No stat lines occurs for commits that are empty (done by git commit 
--allow-empty), since no files are changed. The last index of the 
newline character will situate before the ref name details, and info
line will contain all characters before that index while stat line 
contains the ref name details. Since the ref name is no longer in 
the info lines, accessing the REF_NAME_INDEX within the info lines 
will incur an ArrayOutOfBoundsException.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1027] Modify UI for tags (#1028)
commitResults.messageBody:
Some tags split to the next line when the list of tags are too long. 
Tags also appear vertically close together when the list occupies 
more than one line.

Let's change the css property `display` to be `inline-block` and add 
some top and bottom margins to each tag.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#999] Remove empty zoom__day divs (#1000)
commitResults.messageBody:
When granularity is set to week, the 'pushCommitsWeek' method gets 
all possible weeks (week 1, 2, 3, etc...) from start date until the 
end date and pushes it to 'user.commits', no matter the week has any 
commits at all. Additionally, commits with zero insertions but with 
deletions are also not taken into consideration in the commits 
panel.

Weeks that have no commits is not useful and redundant. Commits with
only deletions are maybe useful as it may represent 
refactoring/removing redundant code.

Let's add a check to add a week only if it has commits. And remove 
the check for commits with zero insertions, so that commits with 
only deletions are also included.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1043] Fix bug of incorrect commit dates when merge group (#1045)
commitResults.messageBody:
When merge group is checked, some commits are seen with committed
dates that are incompatible to the real committed dates.

Commits with the same date are appended together in 'mergedCommits'.
Since 'mergedCommits' is being sorted before all the merged commits 
for a particular group is gathered, the order of the 'mergedCommits' 
is changed, and some commits with the same date are appended 
wrongly.

Let's move the sorting of 'mergedCommits' after the all merged 
commits are gathered, this will ensure commits with the same date 
are appended correctly.

The order of the 'mergedCommits' matters, as we use an additional js 
object 'dateToIndexMap' maps dates to the corresponding index in 
'mergedCommits'. Once the order has changed, the 'dateToIndexMap' no 
longer contains the accurate mappings and hence, commits are 
appended wrongly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add commit message length configuration border (#1048)
commitResults.messageBody:
GitHub's maximum length of commit message's subject line and body is 
defaulted at 50 and 72 characters respectively.

Commits panel does not show the indication of the maximum lengths.

Let's add a dotted lines for commit message bodies at 72 characters 
and subject lines at 50 characters, these lines indicate whether a 
commit message's subject line or body exceed GitHub's maximum 
length.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1005, #1010] Code Panel: match font with GitHub and break lines when overflow (#1008)
commitResults.messageBody:
When the file path or lines of code overflows, it takes up a large 
amount of empty space in order to accomodate to it's length. The 
font size of the code and file path is also rather big and takes up 
much space.

Let's set the file path and lines of code to break into next lines 
when it overflows. Also, let's set the font-family and font-size of 
the code to match with GitHub.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1109] Config.json: include active author and pug file format (#1123)
commitResults.messageBody:
The default configuration consists of authors that are no longer
active in committing code to RepoSense. The jade file format is
no longer used in RepoSense as it is replaced by pug file format.

Let's 
- add a recent active author, as it may reveal potential bugs
- replace jade to pug file format

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1140] Update date hashes when updating date range (#1141)
commitResults.messageBody:
Clicking on the `show ramp chart in this period` button does not update 
the `since` and `until` date hashes, which leads to a different summary 
period after reloading the page.

This is due to the `hasModifedSinceDate` and `hasModifiedUntilDate` not
set to true when calling `updateDateRange`, which prevents the since and 
until date hashes to be updated.

Let's set `hasModifedSinceDate` and `hasModifiedUntilDate` to be true 
when updateDateRange is called.

commitResults.messageTitle: v_summary: refactor the structure of summary-charts__title (#1106)
commitResults.messageBody:
The `summary-charts__title` div is separated in two, each for when
`filterGroupSelection` is `groupByRepos` and `groupByAuthors` 
respectively.

There is overlapping in code among the two, and adding a new 
common component in `summary-charts__title` needs to be done twice, 
which is redundant.

Let's refactor the structure `summary-charts__title` div to share 
the common divs/components.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#950] Use Surge as alternative for Netlify (#1165)
commitResults.messageBody:
Netlify's build quota is not enough for RepoSense's build usage.

Let's deploy on Surge instead, using Travis to run the build and 
provide a Github Status on each PR that links users to the deployed 
Surge site.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1167] Revert PR #967 while keeping zoom tab independent of summary (#1172)
commitResults.messageBody:
PR #967 causes multiple bugs in zoom tab and authorship tab, due to
some data value inside the side panels are not re-rendered when prop 
`info` changes.

Fixing these bugs may delay our upcoming release, so reverting the 
changes that lead to these bugs may be the best option.

Let's revert that PR while only keeping the changes to make the zoom 
tab to be independent of summary.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#779] Restore zoom tab (#830)
commitResults.messageBody:
The zoom tab hashes are not encoded in the URL when zoom tab is 
opened.

Zoom tab will not be restorable with the URL after reloading the 
page.

Let's add the encoding of zoom tab hashes to the URL make the zoom 
tab restorable after reloading the page.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#873] Enable view commits option when merge group (#1100)
commitResults.messageBody:
The view commits option is not available when merge group option is 
checked.

Let's enable the view option when merge group, as the zoom in 
function is already working with merged ramps. Let's also fix the 
regression from #1106 that removes the github icon when merge group 
and `filterGroupSelection` is 'groupByRepos'.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1087] Update badges in README (#1194)
commitResults.messageBody:
RepoSense's Netlify badge icon is a custom icon. We are missing 
acknowledgment to Surge as well.

Let's update the badge to Netlify's official badge that reflects our
Netlify deployment status. Let's also acknowledge Surge in helping 
with our web previews.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1201] Fix regressions of PR #779 (#1203)
commitResults.messageBody:
There are regressions caused by PR #779, where the `zIsMerge` and 
`zFilterGroup` properties are not used properly within zoom tab. 
They are using `isMergeGroup` and `filterGroupSelection` instead.

Let's modify them to use `zIsMerge` and `zFilterGroup` instead, in 
this way the zoom tab will be using the correct property values.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#956] Convert documentation to MarkBind and deploy using Surge (#1225)
commitResults.messageBody:
Our User Guide and Development Guide is using markdown.

Let's include the deployment of MarkBind docs to Surge, while adding
the Github status that redirects to the link of the deployed site.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1147] Generate random filetype colour when predefined colours are used up (#1148)
commitResults.messageBody:
The filetype colours are chosen through a rotation of the predefined 
colour values. So if the number of filetypes exceeds the number of 
predefined colours, there will be repetitions of the same colour.

The repeated filetypes may be hard to distinguish among one
another, in terms of their colours.

Let's generate a random colour for the filetypes after the standard
selection of predefined colours have been exhausted.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1181] Allow filtering of ramps by file type (#1192)
commitResults.messageBody:
All ramps are shown even when some file types are filtered out, the
sizes of ramps are also not adjusted when their filetypes are 
filtered out.

This may cause confusion in users as they would think that the ramps 
will be filtered out accordingly.

Let's add the filtering of ramps by the file types that are selected, 
the size of the ramp will also be adjusted based on that.

Additional Info:
1. The current git log results does not include filetypes that are
modified, so I decided to get from the backend by changing the
git log format. The filetype details of each commit are also added
to the commit.json

2. 'git log --numstat --shortstat' is used instead of 'git log --stat'
to retrieve the log with files changed. This is because --stat only 
shows the sum of lines changed in file whereas --numstat displays 
addition and deletion separately. Addition and deletion of binary
files will be '-' and '-'.

3. When removing a filetype from a ramp, the corresponding addition
and deletion will be removed from the ramp. A ramp will only be 
removed when all of it's filetypes are removed.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#996] Add functionality to view code for entire repository (#1175)
commitResults.messageBody:
There's no way of viewing the code authored for the entire repository.
This is particularly useful when users want to see the code contribution
of the repository as a whole.

We can allow this functionality by enabling the code icon when merge
group.

Let's add the functionality to view code for the entire repository, when
merge group is checked.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1170] Update total contribution to reflect based on checked file types (#1171)
commitResults.messageBody:
When some filetypes are unchecked, the contribution bar length adjusts 
to the correct length, while the total line contribution of each group 
does not. Additionally, when toggling sorting controls to decreasing 
order of contribution, groups with higher total contribution are seen 
to be in lower position than groups with lower contribution. This may 
cause confusion among users.

Let's update the total contribution to reflect the total contribution 
among those file types that are checked.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1242] Move removal of zoom hashes to be within v_zoom component (#1243)
commitResults.messageBody:
The removal of zoom hashes are done in main.js, while the removal
of authorship hashes is done within the v_authorship component
itself.

We can move the responsibility to remove zoom hashes to be within 
the v_zoom component itself, in the 'beforeDestroy' hook. This 
will result in a cleaner implementation and separation of concern.

Let's move the removal of zoom hashes to be within v_zoom
component itself.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1244] Add handling of filenames wrapped in double quotes (#1247)
commitResults.messageBody:
When a filename contains special characters such as double quotes
or the backslash character \, git log will escape those characters and
surround the entire file name with double quotes.

CommitInfoAnalyzer is not handling these cases, which will lead to an
assertion error that fails the entire analysis.

Let's add the handling of such cases, removing the surrounded quotes
from the filenames, if available.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1220] Add front end tests for summary chart functionalities (#1228)
commitResults.messageBody:
Our coverage for front end tests is rather low. UI regressions will be
harder to discover due to this.

Let's add front end tests for summary chart's functionalities such as 
merge group, zoom, filter breakdown features and the restoring of 
summary controls after page reloads.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bug when restoring zoom tab (#1261)
commitResults.messageBody:
When group by authors and groups are merged, the commits are 
not shown correctly in the zoom tab after reloading the page.

This occurs especially for an author with contribution in several 
repositories, as the repositories of the author are treated as 
separate groups (should be pushed into same group) within the
'restoreZoomFiltered' method. This leads to the merging of group 
not being able to merge all the repositories of the author, as 
they are treated as separate groups. 

The searched field is also not handled by zoom tab as well, 
leading to the reloaded zoom tab containing commits that are
not by users that match the searched field.

Let's modify the 'restoreZoomFiltered' method to treat the
repositories of an author to be in the same group, instead of 
being separate groups. Let's also add the handling of the
search field when reloading the zoom tab.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1259] Add index number and files changed count (#1262)
commitResults.messageBody:
The authorship tab does not show the total number of files changed 
as well as the index of the files changed.

Let's add the index of the files changed together with the files 
changed count. The numbers will be reactive based on the checked 
file types.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1241] Restore checked file types (#1256)
commitResults.messageBody:
The checked file types in summary panel is not restorable after
reloading the page.

This is due to the checked file types not being saved in the hash.

Let's add the checked file types hash to allow the checked file types
to be restored after reloading the page.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add optional check for quotes in diff file regex (#1330)
[#1322] Fix loading page rendering issue (#1334)
commitResults.messageBody:
The contents within `v-resizer` show at the beginning of page load.

This is because we write our code directly to `index.pug` instead of
a separate file, e.g. app.pug. The generated HTML file from 
`index.pug` contains some body HTML code, which is recognized by the 
browser and displayed first before the JS code is loaded.

Let's move the v-if conditional out of v-resizer to a Vue template,
since the Vue template tag is not recognizable by the browser.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1312] Conditional run for markbind to gh pages deployment (#1337)
commitResults.messageBody:
The markbind to gh pages deployment task of Travis is executed at 
every pull request, which runs npm install but do not deploy to the
gh pages since it is not the master branch. This is unnecessary 
and takes up build time.

Let's ensure that the deployment task to be only run when it is from 
the master branch.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1345] Authorship: Add last modified date to each LoC if specified (#1348)
commitResults.messageBody:
The last modified date of each line of code is not present in the
`authorship.json`.

It would be beneficial for tutors to use the last modified date of
each line of code to do further processing.

Let's add the last modified date of each line of code within the
`authorship.json`. This functionality will only be enabled when the
user specifies the flag '--last-modified-date' or '-l' in short.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1374] Travis: utilise latest node version for PR docs deployment (#1381)
commitResults.messageBody:
The deployment of PR docs are used with an outdated node version, 
which causes the building of Markbind to fail.

Setting the node version to the latest version will fix the issue, 
as Markbind requires node version >= v10.13.0 installed.

Let's specify the node version for the deployment to be `lts/*`, 
which will ensure that the Markbind runs without errors.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update `About us` page (#1393)
commitResults.messageBody:
The `About us` page contains outdated information as some 
contributors no longer participate in RepoSense.

Let's update the `About us` page to reflect the most recent team 
arrangements.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#865] AuthorConfig: further improve the branch field (#878)
commitResults.messageBody:
In the author-config.csv, branch is an optional field that will
automatically uses the default branch in the repo field.

However, this can be improved such that if the branch field is not
filled, we can bind that AuthorConfig to all the RepoConfig that has the
same repo's location irregardless of branch. This can help users to
easily setup config files to analyse multiple branches of a repo.

Let's bind the AuthorConfig to all the RepoConfig that has the same
repo's location irregardless of branch if the branch field is not
filled.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#900] group-config.csv: make location optional (#914)
commitResults.messageBody:
In the group-config.csv, location is a compulsory field that only has one
value.  Specifying groups for all repos requires the user to manually key
in groups for each repo.

However, this can be improved such that if the location field is not
filled, we can bind that GroupConfig to all the RepoConfig. This can
help the user save the time listing all the possible combinations of
repos and groups when they want to specify groups for all repos.

Let's bind the GroupConfig to all the RepoConfig if the location
field is not filled.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#980] URL: date adapted without validation (#990)
commitResults.messageBody:
Date in authorship can be modified using URL. However, a date range will 
still be adapted even if it is invalid.

This can be fixed by adding extra validation function for window hash.

Let's put a validation for the date parameters in the URL.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1009] AppVeyor Failing: remove outdated tests (#1015)
commitResults.messageBody:
AppVeyor CI is failing in all PRs as it has updated its worker 
image, which uses Git 2.25 instead of Git 2.23.

From Git v2.24, Git for windows would print error for an illegal
file name and prevent it from adding into the index. As in our test 
cases we run the command `git checkout someInvalidName`, an 
exception is expected to be thrown, and since we do not catch it, 
the tests fail. 

Let's remove the 2 outdated test as the git command now handles
detection of invalid filename and will throw exception at the very
beginning.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#885] Allow reset search filter (#895)
commitResults.messageBody:
The user has to manually delete the keywords and press another enter 
to go back to the full view.

However, this can be improved by providing a reset button to clear 
the search bar, which can help the user save time for deleting. 

Let's provide a button to reset the search bar.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#988] Ramp chart: inconsistency in the length of contribution line (#991)
commitResults.messageBody:
Toggling the `breakdown by filetype` checkbox changes the length of the
contribution bar even though the LoC remains constant.

This occurs due to the inaccurate data in json file. The
authorFileTypeContributionMap in commit.json have multiple entries of the 
same key. In the frontend, the last entry would be taken instead of all 
of the entries provided. This results in the wrong calculation of the total 
contribution of each file type.

Let's override FileType#hashCode to correctly update the LoC number 
instead of creating a new entry.

In the backend, we use AuthorshipSummary#addAuthorContributionCount
to increment line number and we consider FileType (the key) and
LoC (the value) as an entry in the HashMap. The HashMap is then output
to the commit.json file as authorFileTypeContributionMap. However, the 
default HashCode will digest all data stored in FileType, other data 
like path and pathsGlob is also taken into consideration when comparing 
the key to update the entry. So, instead of updating, a new entry will 
be created. Thus in AuthorshipSummary#authorFileTypeContributionMap, 
each author can have multiple entry with same FileType#label. And the 
resulted authorFileTypeContributionMap in json file will have multiple 
entry of the same key.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#920] Ramp chart: show percentile for each item (#922)
commitResults.messageBody:
We have index number for each group in the ramp chart but not its
percentile. It is hard to tell the ranking position of the group.

This can be improved to show the percentile of each item so that it
is easy to see whether an item is in the 20%th percentile and so on.

Let's add a percentile number at the right side of each group.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#838] ZoomTab: add sort controls  (#943)
commitResults.messageBody:
We have Zoom tab shows the list of commits in the order from
earliest to latest commits (without an option to reverse the sorting
order or change the sorting type).

This can be improved by allowing the user to view the commits in
reverse chronological order and add other sorting options such as
LOC.

Let's add a sorting field to allow the user to sort the commits
according to Loc or time, and also allow the commits to be
displayed in reverse order.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1031] Commits panel: ramp appears outside row (#1034)
commitResults.messageBody:
The ramp slice in Commits panel may appear outside of the blue 
rectangle.

We should crop the ramp slice if it appears outside of the row, like
what we did for the Chart panel.

Let's set the overflow property to be hidden for the ramp div.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1023] Authorship Panel: expand all button always appear when first open the page (#1040)
commitResults.messageBody:
The `expand all` button will always appear on the authorship panel 
when we first open the page or when refresh the page, until the
loading is complete. The button to display is supposed to be
`collapse all` as we are to display all the file details initially.

Let's display the `collapse all` button at the very beginning, and 
update all relevant checkboxes, radio buttons using proper Vue 
model.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1071] Zoom view: provide a way to highlight the commit (#1075)
commitResults.messageBody:
Clicking a tag jumps to a list of commits full of tags. Users may
not be able to find the commit with that tag easily.

We can highlight the resulting commit with that particular tag by 
providing a light blue border around the message div.

Let's add a focus property to the commit message body.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#576] Refactor summary from index (#1062)
commitResults.messageBody:
The entire v_summary template resides in the index pug file.

Let's refactor v_summary to move it into its own component so that 
RepoSense's dashboard is much more extendable in the future.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#892] Ramp chart: allow filtering by file type/group (#1025)
commitResults.messageBody:
We have code view can be filtered by file type/group but ramp chart in 
Chart Panel cannot be filtered and sorted like that.

This can be improved by only display selected portion of contribution
bar corresponding to selected file type. Also, if the user choose to 
sort by contribution, only the file types in selected ones will be 
considered.

Let's add a set of file type check boxes in Chart panel and only display
and sort according to selected file types.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1124] Authorship: file name starting with period not displayed (#1125)
commitResults.messageBody:
File with name starting with period will not have its detail 
displayed on authorship panel.

This is due to the minimatch library used which by default will not
match name `a/**/b` with `a/.d/b`, unless dot is set. So the file is
filtered out from selected files.

Let's set the dot property to true to allow the file details to be
displayed properly.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#576] Refactor summary charts from summary (#1059)
commitResults.messageBody:
* Refactor summary and charts out

* remove wrapper class

* Perform filter in summary

* folder structure

* update

* update

* remove extra blank line

* remove empty data

* reset updatefilter

* change name to vSummaryCharts

* use filteredrepo

* fix

* change naming

* fix

* codacy

* ci

Co-authored-by: 0blivious <lyw@415309@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: WANG CHAO <1229983126@qq.com>

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1213] Regressions from #1059 (#1218)
commitResults.messageBody:
With the recent merged PR #1059, the data related to sorting were not
passed from v_summary to v_summary_charts, even though
v_summary_charts uses those data within openTabZoom method.

This results in zoom tab to not be restorable at some situations, as it 
is unable to utilise the sorting options. However, the sorting options
and the call for sortFiltered is actually not needed
within the restoreZoomFiltered method. This is because the
matchZoomUser within restoreZoomFiltered will already filter out
other groups/repos. Thus, there is no need to pass those props into
v_summary_charts.

Let's remove the unnecessary parameters and methods.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1084] Authorship: append file type label (#1093)
commitResults.messageBody:
The user has no means to see the file belong to which file group.

This can be improved by appending a label at the end of the file
title to allow user get an easy view of which file type the file
belongs to.

Let's append a coloured label at the end of the file title to indicate
which file type the tile belongs to.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#961] Add Vuex for event management (#1162)
commitResults.messageBody:
The open of zoom and authorship tap is done through event
emit calls now and the code will become messy after #1101 
and #1059 get merged.

We can try to use Vuex to manage the event and call it in a
more elegant way.

Let's try to explore the use of Vuex for event management.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1164] Move to api.js for all global functions (#1176)
commitResults.messageBody:
Global functions and constants are registered in multiple js files
which makes them hard to trace.

We can move all the global functions to api.js to make the code more 
readable and easier to refactor in the future.

Let's use api.js to store all the global functions and constants.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1150] Consistency between Code panel and Chart panel for file type selection (#1152)
commitResults.messageBody:
The file type selection is always set to select all when opened at
first.

With the new sort by file type feature in Chart Panel, we can
auto-set the file types of the code panel to match the file type
selection of the ramp chart.

Let's pass the file type selection information to Code Panel.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1240] Remove insertion and deletion of each commit in commits.json (#1269)
commitResults.messageBody:
Since the line contribution info of each file type is already within 
individual commit, we can remove the insertion and deletion info of 
each commit in the `commits.json` file. Same for
`authorFinalContributionMap`.

The insertion and deletion info can be calculated in the front
end instead, by summing up all the insertion and deletion of
all filetypes within a commit.

Let's remove the insertion and deletion in commit.json file and
calculate them in the front end.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#155] Display date ranged commit in side bar (#1101)
commitResults.messageBody:
When the granularity is set to daily or weekly, clicking on the ramp 
slice redirect the user to a new tab where they will see the 
information of the individual commits from GitHub itself.

This requires the user to switch between different tabs to view 
relevant info. This can be distracting and troublesome for the user,
especially when trying to traverse through multiple weeks of 
commits. We can improve this by opening the zoom tab for the 
corresponding date ranged commits instead of open another Github 
page.

Let's open the zoom tab when the user clicking the ramp with the
granularity set to daily or week, instead of opening new page.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix additional upward movement on expanding code (#966)
commitResults.messageBody:
Clicking the expand button may cause the code to move up a bit 
before expanding. This occurs more frequently when the number of 
code lines to load is large, or the client is slow. 

This is due to asynchronous data loading by Vue, causing observable 
CSS updates to the code block before the code has been loaded into 
the DOM.

Let's execute the CSS change for the code block only after the 
segment's code lines have been loaded.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1137, #1138] Expand pug-lint glob and remove fix option in lint (#1136)
commitResults.messageBody:
The pug-lint command does not expand globs provided as arguments,
relying instead on bash wildcard expansion. This causes the pug-lint
command to fail on windows. The main linting script was also written 
with the --fix option, which can increase the build time for CI.

This may also cause auto-fixable errors to go undetected, although 
the lint script has an extra `--` that causes `--fix` to be 
recognised as a file.

Let’s 
- manually expand the globs for the `pug-lint` command, moving it to
a separate script for brevity.
- remove the `--fix` option used by the main linting script.
- introduce `--fix` for `stylelint`.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#202, #1081] Authorship: improve file collapsing mechanism (#1065)
commitResults.messageBody:
The authorship tab relies on several dom querying methods to toggle
whether a file is collapsed from view. This hurts the performance of 
file collapsing and detracts from the use of Vue as RepoSense’s 
front-end framework, decreasing code readability.

Occasionally, a small number of files have a large number of line 
contributions. This slows the initial loading time at best and 
causes the application to crash at worst.

Let's
- add a new variable 'active' in the `file` object, allowing Vue 
  reactivity to take over this toggle behavior, which also fixes 
  the bug with files not staying collapsed after changing the file 
  filter.
- display both the expand and collapse all buttons according to that
  new property.
- collapse files with more than 2000 lines of code by default.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Ramp and Zoom globals (#1114)
commitResults.messageBody:
The ramp and zoom components have some component specific methods
and variables that can be moved inside the component definition.

Let's do so, encapsulating component logic within the component 
itself.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove duplicate commits in daily contributions (#1050)
commitResults.messageBody:
Two or more authors under with the same extracted commit may result in
the commit being added multiple times to an author’s daily contribution.

This occurs when these authors use some identical aliases, which causes
the same author to be retrieved from the commit result for adding to
the daily contribution.
This can be reproduced by configuring said authors, or using no author
config under the above conditions.

Let's add a duplicate commit check to the commit analyzing process to
prevent this.

Co-authored-by: Peh Xian Bin, Eugene <eugenepeh@users.noreply.github.com>

commitResults.messageTitle: Add auto scrolling when a segment is collapsed (#1090)
commitResults.messageBody:
When a segment is collapsed, the scroll position of the authorship view
remains at the same position.
This can the user to feel lost after collapsing the segment.

Let's implement auto scrolling for the segment collapse button.
If the top button is out of the user’s view, the authorship view will be
scrolled to the segment’s top.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#910] Save authorship tab controls as hash parameters (#1057)
commitResults.messageBody:
The filter and sorting options for the authorship tab are not persisted
across page reloads.

This results having to re-select the options whenever the page is
reloaded, leading to a less pleasant user experience.

Let's save the options for these controls as hash parameters, and use
them across page reloads when available.

commitResults.messageTitle: [#1173] Move tab resizing to a new component (#1179)
commitResults.messageBody:
Tab resizing logic resides within the entry script file, which 
already contains quite a bit of application logic.

Let's move the resizing logic and user interface into a new vue
component, v_resize.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add summary_charts to puglint file list (#1277)
commitResults.messageBody:
The summary_charts.pug file is not included in the pug lint list.

Let's add summary_charts.pug to pug lint file list.
